leaf_cluster_name: 天文-观测数据处理与源检测生态
task_chain: 校准→源检测→测光→匹配→平台

tools.name: perl-Astro-FITS-HdrTrans
tools.one_line_profile: Perl module for translating astronomical FITS metadata headers
tools.detailed_description: A Perl module designed to perform translations of astronomical metadata headers between FITS format and generic representations.

tools.name: AstroBinUploader
tools.one_line_profile: Script to parse FITS/XISF headers and generate AstroBin-compatible CSVs
tools.detailed_description: A Python script that parses directories of astronomical images (FITS/XISF), reads header information, and creates a summary CSV file formatted for upload to AstroBin.

tools.name: lunarsky
tools.one_line_profile: Astropy extension for lunar surface observations
tools.detailed_description: An extension to the Astropy library that provides coordinate transformations and observation planning capabilities specifically for observers located on the surface of the Moon.

tools.name: SerStacker
tools.one_line_profile: Planetary image stacking tool using OpenCV
tools.detailed_description: Experimental software for stacking planetary astronomical images, utilizing OpenCV for image processing tasks.

tools.name: SImMER
tools.one_line_profile: Reduction pipeline for astronomical images of point sources
tools.detailed_description: An open-source and modular data reduction pipeline designed for processing astronomical images, specifically focusing on point sources.

tools.name: AstraLite
tools.one_line_profile: Deepsky astrophotography and live stacking software
tools.detailed_description: Software designed for deep sky astrophotography and live image stacking, optimized for low-power computing devices like Raspberry Pi.

tools.name: ASDF
tools.one_line_profile: Advanced Scientific Data Format library
tools.detailed_description: The reference implementation of the Advanced Scientific Data Format (ASDF), a next-generation interchange format for scientific data, widely used in astronomy (e.g., JWST).

tools.name: wcsaxes
tools.one_line_profile: Library for plotting astronomical data with WCS coordinates
tools.detailed_description: A framework for plotting astronomical data in Matplotlib with support for World Coordinate Systems (WCS). Note: Now merged into Astropy core.

tools.name: go-cfitsio
tools.one_line_profile: CGo bindings for the FITSIO library
tools.detailed_description: Provides Go language bindings for the standard CFITSIO library, enabling reading and writing of FITS files in Go applications.

tools.name: fitsio
tools.one_line_profile: Pure-Go package to read and write FITS files
tools.detailed_description: A native Go library for reading and writing FITS (Flexible Image Transport System) files without requiring C dependencies.

tools.name: fitsjs
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript library for reading FITS files
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for reading FITS astronomical format files in the browser or Node.js, supporting images, data cubes, and tables.

tools.name: spark-fits
tools.one_line_profile: FITS data source for Apache Spark
tools.detailed_description: A library that enables Apache Spark to read and process FITS files as DataFrames, facilitating distributed processing of astronomical data.

tools.name: asdf-astropy
tools.one_line_profile: ASDF serialization support for Astropy objects
tools.detailed_description: An extension library that provides the necessary tags and schemas to serialize and deserialize Astropy objects using the ASDF standard.

tools.name: Astropy
tools.one_line_profile: Core library for Astronomy and Astrophysics
tools.detailed_description: A community-driven Python library for astronomy, providing core functionality for FITS IO, WCS, units, coordinates, and more.

tools.name: astropy-healpix
tools.one_line_profile: HEALPix implementation for Astropy
tools.detailed_description: A BSD-licensed implementation of HEALPix (Hierarchical Equal Area isoLatitude Pixelization) for use with the Astropy ecosystem.

tools.name: astroquery
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to query online astronomical data services
tools.detailed_description: A package for querying online astronomical data services and catalogs (e.g., SIMBAD, VizieR, ESA, NASA) and retrieving data.

tools.name: astrowidgets
tools.one_line_profile: Jupyter widgets for astronomy
tools.detailed_description: A set of Jupyter widgets designed for interactive visualization and analysis of astronomical data within the Astropy ecosystem.

tools.name: ccdproc
tools.one_line_profile: Library for reducing optical/IR CCD data
tools.detailed_description: An Astropy affiliated package providing tools for the basic reduction of CCD data, including bias subtraction, flat fielding, and cosmic ray rejection.

tools.name: photutils
tools.one_line_profile: Source detection and photometry library
tools.detailed_description: An Astropy package for detecting sources in astronomical images and performing photometry (aperture and PSF).

tools.name: pyregion
tools.one_line_profile: Parser for ds9 region files
tools.detailed_description: A Python module to parse ds9 region files and convert them into matplotlib patches or Astropy region objects.

tools.name: pyvo
tools.one_line_profile: Access to Virtual Observatory (VO) services
tools.detailed_description: A package providing access to remote data and services of the Virtual Observatory (VO) using Python.

tools.name: regions
tools.one_line_profile: Astropy package for region handling
tools.detailed_description: A package for representing, manipulating, and plotting regions of the sky or images within the Astropy ecosystem.

tools.name: specreduce
tools.one_line_profile: Spectroscopic reduction tools
tools.detailed_description: A package providing tools for the reduction of spectroscopic observations from Optical and NIR instruments.

tools.name: specutils
tools.one_line_profile: Astropy coordinated package for astronomical spectroscopy analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing a shared set of classes, concepts, and tools for the representation, manipulation, and analysis of astronomical spectroscopic data, part of the Astropy ecosystem.

tools.name: fitscore
tools.one_line_profile: Native Swift library for reading and writing FITS astronomical data files
tools.detailed_description: A Swift library designed to handle the Flexible Image Transport System (FITS) file format, enabling the reading and writing of astronomical data on Apple platforms.

tools.name: NPTFit
tools.one_line_profile: Non-Poissonian Template Fitting package for astrophysical data analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python/Cython package for performing Non-Poissonian Template Fits (NPTF), primarily used in high-energy astrophysics to analyze photon count maps and detect unresolved point source populations (e.g., in Fermi data).

tools.name: CARACal
tools.one_line_profile: Containerized Automated Radio Astronomy Calibration pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for the reduction and calibration of radio interferometry data, designed to be automated and containerized for reproducibility, supporting telescopes like MeerKAT.

tools.name: fitsrs
tools.one_line_profile: Pure Rust implementation of a FITS file reader
tools.detailed_description: A library written in Rust for parsing and reading FITS (Flexible Image Transport System) files, providing high-performance IO for astronomical data.

tools.name: agnpy
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for modelling radiative processes in active galactic nuclei
tools.detailed_description: A library to model the radiative processes of jetted Active Galactic Nuclei (AGN), calculating spectral energy distributions (SEDs) for leptonic and hadronic models.

tools.name: fitdistrplus
tools.one_line_profile: R package for fitting parametric distributions to data
tools.detailed_description: An R package that helps to fit parametric probability distributions to non-censored or censored data, providing functions for estimation, comparison, and visualization of fits.

tools.name: protopipe
tools.one_line_profile: Prototype data analysis pipeline for the Cherenkov Telescope Array
tools.detailed_description: A prototype pipeline for the analysis of data from the Cherenkov Telescope Array (CTA), handling data calibration, image cleaning, and reconstruction.

tools.name: ASPIRED
tools.one_line_profile: Automated SpectroPhotometric Image REDuction pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based pipeline for the automated reduction of spectrophotometric data, handling tasks from image processing to spectral extraction and calibration.

tools.name: Astro Live Stacker
tools.one_line_profile: Live stacking software for deep sky astrophotography
tools.detailed_description: A tool for real-time stacking of astronomical images, allowing for live observation and enhancement of deep sky objects during data acquisition.

tools.name: Astrometry.net
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic astrometric calibration and recognition of astronomical images
tools.detailed_description: A reliable and robust system for astrometric calibration, capable of taking an astronomical image and determining its pointing, scale, and orientation without prior information.

tools.name: funtools
tools.one_line_profile: Minimal buy-in FITS library and utility package
tools.detailed_description: A library and set of analysis programs for astronomical data, focusing on FITS images and binary tables, providing simplified access and manipulation capabilities.

tools.name: astropysics
tools.one_line_profile: Library of astrophysics utilities and algorithms
tools.detailed_description: A python library containing a variety of utilities and algorithms for astrophysics, including coordinate transformations, photometric calculations, and instrument modeling.

tools.name: sunPytools
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for differential privacy and data analysis
tools.detailed_description: A library providing implementations of differential privacy mechanisms and other data analysis utilities, facilitating privacy-preserving data science.

tools.name: OWL
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight pipeline execution framework for astronomical workflows
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline/workflow execution framework designed for the repeated execution of static workflows, suitable for data centers and astronomical observatories.

tools.name: Gammapy
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for gamma-ray astronomy analysis
tools.detailed_description: An open-source Python package for gamma-ray astronomy, enabling the analysis of astronomical gamma-ray data, including data reduction, modeling, and fitting.

tools.name: gpi_pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Data Reduction Pipeline for the Gemini Planet Imager
tools.detailed_description: The official data reduction pipeline for the Gemini Planet Imager (GPI), used to process raw data from the instrument into calibrated scientific products.

tools.name: Astrofiler
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomy Image Management software
tools.detailed_description: A GUI-based tool for managing and organizing astronomical images, likely handling FITS metadata and file organization.

tools.name: Numina
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomical data reduction package
tools.detailed_description: A data reduction package for astronomical observations, providing algorithms and tools for processing data from various instruments.

tools.name: SelfOrganizingMaps
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for fitting self-organizing maps
tools.detailed_description: A library that implements Self-Organizing Maps (SOM) for dimensionality reduction and data visualization, applicable to scientific data analysis.

tools.name: cfitsio
tools.one_line_profile: Mirror of the CFITSIO library for FITS file manipulation
tools.detailed_description: A library of C and Fortran subroutines for reading and writing data files in FITS (Flexible Image Transport System) data format.

tools.name: Tangra 3
tools.one_line_profile: Software for data reduction of astronomical video observations
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed for the reduction and analysis of astronomical video data, often used for occultation or light curve measurements.

tools.name: IRAF
tools.one_line_profile: Image Reduction and Analysis Facility
tools.detailed_description: A general purpose software system for the reduction and analysis of astronomical data, widely used in the astronomical community.

tools.name: PyRAF
tools.one_line_profile: Python command language for IRAF
tools.detailed_description: A command language for running IRAF tasks that is based on the Python scripting language, allowing IRAF tasks to be used in Python scripts.

tools.name: x11iraf
tools.one_line_profile: X11/GUI utilities for IRAF
tools.detailed_description: A collection of X11-based GUI utilities and applications for the IRAF system, including image display (ximtool) and graphics terminals (xgterm).

tools.name: glmhmm
tools.one_line_profile: Code to fit GLMs, HMMs, and GLM-HMMs
tools.detailed_description: A library for fitting Generalized Linear Models (GLMs), Hidden Markov Models (HMMs), and combined GLM-HMMs, often used in neuroscience and behavioral analysis.

tools.name: IRAF (joequant fork)
tools.one_line_profile: Community maintenance fork of the Image Reduction and Analysis Facility (IRAF) for astronomical data processing
tools.detailed_description: A fork of the classic IRAF software system, widely used in astronomy for the reduction and analysis of scientific data. While this specific repository is marked obsolete in favor of a newer version, it represents the core IRAF toolset used for processing FITS images and spectroscopic data.

tools.name: gcs_python
tools.one_line_profile: Python implementation of the Graduated Cylindrical Shell (GCS) model for Coronal Mass Ejections
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing the Graduated Cylindrical Shell (GCS) model, used in solar physics to reconstruct the 3D structure of Coronal Mass Ejections (CMEs) from coronagraph images.

tools.name: thorsky
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomical time and sky coordinate utility programs based on Astropy
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python programs for astronomical observing planning and data analysis, providing functionality for time conversion, sky coordinates, and observability calculations, built upon the Astropy ecosystem.

tools.name: rascal
tools.one_line_profile: RANSAC-Assisted Spectral CALibration tool for astronomical spectroscopy
tools.detailed_description: A library for automated spectral wavelength calibration using RANSAC (Random Sample Consensus) to robustly fit polynomial solutions to arc lamp data, specifically designed for astronomical spectrometers.

tools.name: dust_extinction
tools.one_line_profile: Library for modeling interstellar dust extinction in astronomy
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that provides various models for interstellar dust extinction curves, allowing astronomers to correct observational data for the effects of dust scattering and absorption.

tools.name: FITS_tools
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for FITS image manipulation and WCS handling
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing tools for manipulating FITS images, including header processing and World Coordinate System (WCS) transformations, leveraging Scipy and Astropy.

tools.name: legacypipe
tools.one_line_profile: Image reduction pipeline for DESI Legacy Imaging Surveys
tools.detailed_description: The data reduction pipeline used for the DESI Legacy Imaging Surveys, built on the Tractor framework to perform source detection, measurement, and catalog generation from astronomical images.

tools.name: prose
tools.one_line_profile: Modular image processing pipelines for astronomy
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for building modular image processing pipelines, specifically designed for astronomical data reduction and photometry tasks.

tools.name: photometrypipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Automated reduction and photometry pipeline for RATIR and RIMAS
tools.detailed_description: PhotoPipe is a pipeline designed for the automated reduction, photometry, and astrometry of imaging data from specific astronomical instruments (RATIR and RIMAS).

tools.name: nightlight
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomical image processing library in Go
tools.detailed_description: A Go library for processing astronomical images, likely providing basic reduction and manipulation capabilities.

tools.name: astroRMS
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for calculating pixel-to-pixel RMS noise in astronomical images
tools.detailed_description: A Python module for calculating Root Mean Square (RMS) noise maps for astronomical images, accounting for autocorrelation and weight maps, intended as a replacement for IRAF MEDRMS tasks.

tools.name: photometry-sans-frustration
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for IRAF/DAOPHOT PSF photometry
tools.detailed_description: An interactive Python wrapper facilitating Point Spread Function (PSF) photometry using the classic IRAF and DAOPHOT tasks, aiming to simplify the workflow for astronomers.

tools.name: Nova DSO Tracker
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time tracking and observability tool for deep-sky objects
tools.detailed_description: A Flask-based application for astrophotographers and astronomers to track Deep Sky Objects (DSOs), predict observability, and integrate with databases like SIMBAD.

tools.name: reducer
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for astronomical data reduction and calibration
tools.detailed_description: A package for performing standard astronomical data reduction steps (calibration, combining) on imaging data, designed to be user-friendly and robust.

tools.name: radbelt
tools.one_line_profile: Astropy-friendly wrapper for Van Allen belt models
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper for the AE-8/AP-8 Van Allen radiation belt models, integrating with the Astropy ecosystem for space physics applications.

tools.name: astrometry
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for converting star positions to WCS transformations
tools.detailed_description: A tool that calculates pixel-to-sky transformations (World Coordinate System) based on lists of star positions, facilitating astrometric calibration.

tools.name: nom-tam-fits
tools.one_line_profile: Java library for reading and writing FITS files
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Java library for reading and writing FITS (Flexible Image Transport System) files, the standard data format in astronomy.

tools.name: skysolve

tools.detailed_description: A zero-dependency Go library for plate solving astronomical images, determining the celestial coordinates of the image center and adhering to WCS and SIP standards.

tools.name: rsfitsio
tools.one_line_profile: Rust implementation of FITS I/O library
tools.detailed_description: A Rust library for reading and writing FITS files, serving as a re-write or binding for the standard cfitsio functionality in the Rust ecosystem.

tools.name: windrose

tools.name: feets

tools.name: reduceccd

tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for basic reduction of CCD images (bias, dark, flat correction) using the ccdproc package, tailored for astronomical data.

tools.name: but_velodyne_lib

tools.name: PyFOSC

tools.detailed_description: A pipeline toolbox for reducing spectroscopic data from FOSC instruments on Xinglong/Lijiang 2-meter telescopes, handling tasks like calibration and extraction.

tools.name: pderp

tools.detailed_description: A data extraction and reduction pipeline designed for the Palomar Cosmic Web Imager (PCWI), handling integral field spectrograph data processing.

tools.name: astrolibpy
tools.one_line_profile: Python conversion of the IDL Astronomy User's Library
tools.detailed_description: A repository of astronomical utility codes converted from the classic IDL astrolib to Python, providing various routines for astronomical calculations and data handling.

tools.name: rust-fitsio

tools.detailed_description: A Rust interface to the cfitsio library, enabling reading and writing of FITS (Flexible Image Transport System) files in Rust applications.

tools.name: fits

tools.detailed_description: A library written in Go (Golang) for reading FITS (Flexible Image Transport System) files, facilitating astronomical data access in Go programs.

tools.name: goodman_pipeline

tools.detailed_description: A Python-based data reduction pipeline for the Goodman High Throughput Spectrograph at the SOAR Telescope, handling spectroscopic data processing.

tools.name: PyFITS
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for FITS file handling (Legacy)
tools.detailed_description: A Python module for reading, writing, and manipulating FITS files. Note: This project is deprecated and its functionality has been merged into Astropy.

tools.name: acstools
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for the Advanced Camera for Surveys (ACS) on HST
tools.detailed_description: A Python package containing tools for analyzing and processing data from the Hubble Space Telescope's Advanced Camera for Surveys (ACS), including calibration and analysis utilities.

tools.name: astroimtools

tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing convenience tools for processing astronomical images, including calculation of statistics, image arithmetic, and filtering.

tools.name: crds

tools.name: hstaxe

tools.detailed_description: A Python and C package for extracting spectra from slitless spectroscopy data obtained with the Hubble Space Telescope (HST), serving as a successor to the IRAF aXe package.

tools.name: hstcal

tools.detailed_description: The C-based calibration pipeline software for Hubble Space Telescope instruments including WFC3, ACS, and STIS, performing standard data reduction steps.

tools.name: imexam
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive astronomical image examination tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for interactive examination and plotting of astronomical images, providing functionality similar to the classic IRAF 'imexamine' task.

tools.name: jwql
tools.one_line_profile: Quicklook application for JWST data quality monitoring
tools.detailed_description: A software suite for monitoring the quality of data from the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) through quicklook visualization and analysis tools.

tools.name: stsynphot
tools.one_line_profile: Synthetic photometry utilities for HST and JWST
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing synthetic photometry utilities specifically for Hubble Space Telescope (HST) and James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) data, extending the general synphot package.

tools.name: synphot
tools.one_line_profile: General synthetic photometry library
tools.detailed_description: A general-purpose Python library for synthetic photometry, allowing users to simulate photometric data and manipulate spectra and passbands.

tools.name: wfc3tools
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for HST WFC3 data calibration and analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python package containing specialized tools for calibrating and analyzing data from the Wide Field Camera 3 (WFC3) on the Hubble Space Telescope.

tools.name: sip_tpv

tools.detailed_description: A tool to convert between SIP (Simple Imaging Polynomial) and TPV (Tangent Plane with PV distortion) distortion representations in FITS headers.

tools.name: optika
tools.one_line_profile: Optical system simulation library
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for simulating and analyzing optical systems, providing functionality similar to commercial software like Zemax for optical design and ray tracing.

tools.name: ndcube

tools.detailed_description: A Python package for handling multi-dimensional contiguous and non-contiguous coordinate-aware arrays, primarily used for solar physics data cubes.

tools.name: sunkit-instruments

tools.detailed_description: A SunPy-affiliated package providing specialized tools and routines for analyzing data from specific solar physics instruments.

tools.name: sunkit-magex

tools.detailed_description: A Python package for performing magnetic field extrapolations, used in solar physics to model the coronal magnetic field from photospheric observations.

tools.name: sunpy
tools.one_line_profile: Core library for Solar Physics data analysis
tools.detailed_description: The fundamental Python library for solar physics, providing data structures, I/O, and analysis tools for solar data (maps, time series, spectra).

tools.name: sunpy-soar
tools.one_line_profile: Solar Orbiter Archive (SOAR) data access plugin
tools.detailed_description: A SunPy plugin that enables searching and downloading data from the Solar Orbiter Archive (SOAR) directly within the SunPy environment.

tools.name: sunraster
tools.one_line_profile: Solar spectral data analysis tools
tools.detailed_description: A SunPy-affiliated package designed for the analysis of spectral data from solar missions, providing tools for slit spectrograph data processing.

tools.name: JPFITS
tools.one_line_profile: Object-oriented FITS library for C#
tools.detailed_description: A C# .NET library for reading, writing, and interacting with FITS files using an object-oriented approach, built from the ground up.

tools.name: fastrometry

tools.detailed_description: A tool for automatically solving World Coordinate Systems (WCS) for astronomical images, determining the celestial coordinates of image pixels.

tools.name: stan4bart

tools.detailed_description: A library that combines the Stan math library and sampler with Bayesian Additive Regression Trees (BART) to fit semiparametric linear and multilevel models.

tools.name: pydl
tools.one_line_profile: Library of IDL astronomy routines converted to Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that implements common astronomical routines originally written in IDL, facilitating data processing, calibration, and analysis for astronomers transitioning to or working in Python environments.

tools.name: RubyFits

tools.detailed_description: A Ruby library designed for reading and writing FITS (Flexible Image Transport System) files, enabling astronomers to process observational data using the Ruby programming language.

tools.name: astrometry.js

tools.detailed_description: A library that processes FITS images to extract star pixel coordinates, enabling browser-based or Node.js-based astronomical source detection and astrometry tasks.

tools.name: nimcfitsio
tools.one_line_profile: Nim bindings for the CFITSIO library
tools.detailed_description: Provides Nim language bindings to the standard CFITSIO library, allowing efficient FITS file manipulation and I/O operations within the Nim programming environment.

tools.name: pycfitsio

tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper around the CFITSIO C library using ctypes, providing low-level access to FITS file I/O operations for astronomical data processing.

tools.name: pyradiomics

tools.detailed_description: Open-source python package for the extraction of Radiomics features from 2D and 3D images and binary masks. It is widely used in medical image analysis for oncology and other fields.

tools.name: TrueColorTools

tools.detailed_description: GUI application for calculating human-visible colors of celestial bodies from their photometric data, aiding in astronomical visualization and spectral analysis.

tools.name: AutoPhOT
tools.one_line_profile: Automated pipeline for rapid photometry of transients
tools.detailed_description: The AUTOmated Photometry Of Transients (AutoPhOT) is a novel automated pipeline designed for rapid, publication-quality photometry of astronomical transients.

tools.name: AstroPathPipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for processing multiplex immunofluorescence data
tools.detailed_description: The AstroPath Pipeline processes whole slide multiplex immunofluorescence data from microscope to database at single cell resolution, adapting astronomy techniques for pathology.

tools.name: AstroPhot
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomical image 2D forward modelling tool
tools.detailed_description: A fast, flexible, automated, and differentiable astronomical image 2D forward modelling tool for precise parallel multi-wavelength photometry.

tools.name: ProfoundData
tools.one_line_profile: Data and benchmarking for dynamic vegetation models
tools.detailed_description: Provides tools and data for checking and benchmarking dynamic vegetation models, supported by the COST Action FP1304 PROFOUND.

tools.name: mtobjects
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for finding objects in astronomical images
tools.detailed_description: A tool for detecting and finding objects in astronomical images, serving as a development version for source detection tasks.

tools.name: fpocket
tools.one_line_profile: Protein pocket detection algorithm
tools.detailed_description: A very fast open source protein pocket detection algorithm based on Voronoi tessellation, used for drug discovery and structural biology.

tools.name: scAmpi
tools.one_line_profile: Single-cell RNA-seq analysis workflow
tools.detailed_description: A workflow for single-cell RNA sequencing analysis, facilitating the processing and interpretation of scRNA-seq data.

tools.name: HOPS
tools.one_line_profile: Single-object photometry and exoplanet light-curve modelling
tools.detailed_description: A user-friendly software for single-object photometry and exoplanet light-curve modelling, designed for astronomical data analysis.

tools.name: Perturb-OT

tools.detailed_description: Implements labeled Gromov-Wasserstein Optimal Transport for cross-modality matching and prediction, likely for single-cell perturbation studies.

tools.name: TESS-Localize

tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to localize the source of variability in TESS (Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite) photometry. It helps identify target stars and distinguish them from background contaminants.

tools.name: libprofit
tools.one_line_profile: C++ library for generating astronomical images from luminosity profiles
tools.detailed_description: A low-level library for producing images based on different luminosity profiles, commonly used in astronomical source modelling and simulation.

tools.name: EEGWaveNet
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-scale CNN-based spatiotemporal feature extraction for EEG seizure detection
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of EEGWaveNet, a deep learning model for detecting seizures from EEG signals using multi-scale convolutional neural networks to extract spatiotemporal features.

tools.name: pystrometry
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis package for high-precision astrometry timeseries and Keplerian orbit determination
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to support the analysis of high-precision astrometry time-series data, specifically focusing on the determination of Keplerian orbits for binary systems or exoplanets.

tools.name: libnova
tools.one_line_profile: General purpose library for Celestial Mechanics and Astrometry
tools.detailed_description: A double-precision C library for Celestial Mechanics, Astrometry, and Astrodynamics, providing calculations for orbital positions, coordinates, and other astronomical data.

tools.name: nway
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian cross-matching tool for astronomical catalogues
tools.detailed_description: A tool for performing Bayesian cross-matching of multiple astronomical catalogues. It handles position and magnitude information to find probabilistic associations between sources in different datasets.

tools.name: Photometry.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomical photometry utilities for Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library for performing photometry on astronomical images, including aperture photometry and source characterization.

tools.name: WatneyAstrometry
tools.one_line_profile: Astrometric solver library and application for .NET
tools.detailed_description: A blind astrometric solver (plate solver) implemented in C#/.NET, capable of solving astronomical images to determine their coordinates and orientation without prior information.

tools.name: swift-uvot-analysis-tools
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrappers for Swift UVOT photometry analysis
tools.detailed_description: A set of Python tools and wrappers to facilitate basic photometry analysis for data from the Swift UVOT (Ultraviolet/Optical Telescope) instrument.

tools.name: gaia-astrometry-net
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to generate astrometry.net index files from GAIA catalog
tools.detailed_description: A utility to create index files required by the Astrometry.net plate solver using data from the GAIA astronomical catalog, enabling plate solving with GAIA references.

tools.name: WeakLensingDeblending
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation and analysis tools for weak lensing blended objects
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for fast simulations and analysis of blended objects in the context of weak lensing surveys, developed by the LSST Dark Energy Science Collaboration.

tools.name: generate-spectra
tools.one_line_profile: Generative model for astronomical spectra from photometry
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of conditional diffusion models to generate astronomical spectra from photometric images, enabling the estimation of galaxy properties without direct spectroscopy.

tools.name: GuPPy
tools.one_line_profile: Guided Photometry Analysis tool for fiber photometry data
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool for the analysis of fiber photometry (FP) data, commonly used in neuroscience to record neural activity. It provides a GUI for processing and analyzing signal data.

tools.name: pyDIA
tools.one_line_profile: Package for star detection, difference imaging, and photometry
tools.detailed_description: A modular Python package for performing Difference Image Analysis (DIA), including star detection and photometry on astronomical images. Useful for detecting transient events.

tools.name: SARS-CoV-2-Vaccine-RNA-Assemblies
tools.one_line_profile: Assembled mRNA sequences for BNT-162b2 and mRNA-1273 vaccines
tools.detailed_description: A dataset and analysis repository providing experimentally determined mRNA sequences and assemblies for the Moderna and Pfizer/BioNTech COVID-19 vaccines, derived from RNA-seq of vaccine remnants.

tools.name: PhotometryTK
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance toolkit for photometric correction and mosaicking of geospatial/planetary imagery
tools.detailed_description: A C++ toolkit designed for high-performance photometric correction and mosaicking of large-scale imagery datasets. It is part of the NeoGeographyToolkit and is typically used in planetary science and remote sensing to process satellite imagery, ensuring consistent radiometric properties across mosaics.

tools.name: OSCAAR
tools.one_line_profile: Differential photometry code for astronomical research
tools.detailed_description: Open Source differential photometry Code for Amateur Astronomical Research. A Python-based tool designed to perform differential photometry on astronomical images, generating light curves for variable stars or exoplanet transits. It handles calibration, alignment, and flux measurement.

tools.name: Aegean
tools.one_line_profile: Source finding and classification program for radio astronomy
tools.detailed_description: A source finding program designed for radio astronomy images. It performs background characterization, source detection, and characterization (fitting Gaussian components). It includes tools for catalog handling and is optimized for processing radio maps.

tools.name: petrofit
tools.one_line_profile: Galaxy light profile fitting and Petrosian property calculation
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for calculating Petrosian properties (radii, fluxes) and fitting galaxy light profiles (Sersic models). It is built on top of Photutils and Astropy, providing tools for morphological analysis of galaxies in astronomical images.

tools.name: localize-psf
tools.one_line_profile: Localization and PSF fitting for diffraction-limited microscopy
tools.detailed_description: A tool for localizing diffraction-limited fluorescent objects in microscopy images and fitting them to various Point Spread Function (PSF) models. Used in super-resolution microscopy and single-molecule imaging analysis.

tools.name: scamp
tools.one_line_profile: Selective Clustering Annotated using Modes of Projections for flow cytometry
tools.detailed_description: A C++ implementation of the SCAMP algorithm for analyzing flow cytometry data. It performs selective clustering to identify cell populations, typically used in immunology and bioinformatics for high-dimensional single-cell data analysis.

tools.name: artip
tools.one_line_profile: Automated Radio Telescope Imaging Pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based pipeline for automated imaging of radio telescope data. It handles data calibration, flagging, and imaging processes, streamlining the workflow for radio astronomy observations.

tools.name: caesar
tools.one_line_profile: Source finder and extractor for radio astronomy
tools.detailed_description: A C++ source finder tool developed for the SKA (Square Kilometre Array) project context. It is designed to detect and extract sources from radio maps, handling complex source morphologies and providing cataloging capabilities.

tools.name: psfmachine
tools.one_line_profile: PSF photometry toolkit for Kepler and TESS data
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit for performing Point Spread Function (PSF) photometry, specifically optimized for data from Kepler, K2, and TESS missions. It builds PSF models from the data itself to extract high-precision light curves.

tools.name: WD_models
tools.one_line_profile: White Dwarf photometry and physical parameter transformation tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for transforming between White Dwarf (WD) photometry (from surveys like Gaia, SDSS, WISE) and physical parameters. It uses interpolation of atmosphere grids and cooling models to aid in the characterization of white dwarfs.

tools.name: SuperNOVAS
tools.one_line_profile: Enhanced C astrometry library based on NOVAS
tools.detailed_description: An improved version of the Naval Observatory Vector Astrometry Software (NOVAS) C library. It provides high-precision astrometric calculations for celestial coordinates, time, and motion, essential for observational astronomy and data reduction.

tools.name: CAAPR
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive & Adaptable Aperture Photometry Routine
tools.detailed_description: A highly customisable pipeline for performing aperture photometry on astronomical images. It is designed to handle multi-wavelength data and provides robust flux measurements for galaxies and other extended sources.

tools.name: sextractor
tools.one_line_profile: Starlink patched version of SExtractor source detection tool
tools.detailed_description: A version of the widely used SExtractor (Source Extractor) tool, patched and maintained by the Starlink project. It is used for automatically detecting and measuring sources in astronomical images, generating catalogs of stars and galaxies.

tools.name: astrometrylib
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight astrometry.net plate solver library
tools.detailed_description: A stripped-down, C-based library version of the Astrometry.net plate solver. It enables blind astrometric calibration (plate solving) of astronomical images directly within other applications without requiring the full Astrometry.net suite.

tools.name: photometry_preprocessing
tools.one_line_profile: Preprocessing pipeline for fiber photometry data
tools.detailed_description: A workflow for denoising, photobleaching correction, and motion correction of fiber photometry data, commonly used in neuroscience.

tools.name: PyHa
tools.one_line_profile: Bioacoustics pipeline for bird sound event detection
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed to convert audio-based weak labels to strong intraclip labels, comparing automated labels to human labels for bird presence sound event detection.

tools.name: PyGaia
tools.one_line_profile: Gaia science performance simulation toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for simulating the scientific performance of the Gaia mission, including astrometry, photometry, and spectroscopy error models.

tools.name: skypatrol
tools.one_line_profile: Python client for ASAS-SN Sky Patrol data
tools.detailed_description: Official Python client for accessing and interacting with the ASAS-SN (All-Sky Automated Survey for SuperNovae) Sky Patrol data.

tools.name: ProFound
tools.one_line_profile: Source finding and extraction package
tools.detailed_description: A package for source finding and extraction in astronomical images, providing tools for detecting sources and measuring their properties.

tools.name: PSFEx
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for generating PSF (Point Spread Function) super-tabulated models from FITS images
tools.detailed_description: PSFEx (Point Spread Function Extractor) extracts models of the Point Spread Function from FITS images processed with SExtractor. It generates super-tabulated PSF models that can be used for model-fitting photometry or morphological analysis.

tools.name: SCAMP
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for computing astrometric and photometric solutions from SExtractor catalogs
tools.detailed_description: SCAMP (Software for Calibrating AstroMetry and Photometry) computes astrometric and photometric solutions from source catalogs generated by SExtractor. It handles large-scale astrometric calibration and matches sources across multiple catalogs.

tools.name: SExtractor
tools.one_line_profile: Standard tool for extracting catalogs of sources from astronomical images
tools.detailed_description: SExtractor (Source Extractor) is a program that builds a catalogue of objects from an astronomical image. It is particularly oriented towards the reduction of large scale galaxy-survey data and performs background estimation, source detection, deblending, and photometry.

tools.name: Photutils
tools.one_line_profile: Astropy affiliated package for source detection and photometry
tools.detailed_description: Photutils is an Astropy package for detection and photometry of astronomical sources. It provides tools for background estimation, source detection (DAOStarFinder, IRAFStarFinder), aperture photometry, and PSF-fitting photometry.

tools.name: SourceXtractor++
tools.one_line_profile: Next generation source extraction tool based on SExtractor
tools.detailed_description: SourceXtractor++ is a complete rewrite of the SExtractor tool in C++. It is designed to handle large astronomical datasets and provides improved performance and flexibility for source detection, photometry, and catalog generation.

tools.name: forcepho
tools.one_line_profile: Generative modeling tool for galaxy photometry and shape inference
tools.detailed_description: Forcepho is a code for simultaneous multi-band fitting of galaxy fluxes and shapes using MCMC. It is designed for precision photometry and morphological analysis, particularly for JWST data.

tools.name: prysm
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for physical optics modeling and phase retrieval
tools.detailed_description: Prysm is a library for physical optics, including integrated modeling, phase retrieval, segmented systems, and polynomials fitting. It is used for modeling optical systems in astronomy and other physics domains.

tools.name: bolometric-corrections
tools.one_line_profile: Library to compute bolometric corrections and synthetic colors for stars
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool to compute bolometric corrections and synthetic colours for input values of stellar parameters (Teff, logg, [Fe/H], Av), useful for stellar photometry calibration and analysis.

tools.name: WDPhotTools
tools.one_line_profile: Photometric toolkit for White Dwarf research
tools.detailed_description: WDPhotTools is a Python package designed for White Dwarf research, providing tools for photometric analysis, cooling model interpolation, and parameter estimation.

tools.name: galight
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for decomposing galaxy light into PSF and Sersic profiles
tools.detailed_description: Galight is a Python package based on lenstronomy that decomposes galaxy images into Point Spread Function (PSF) and Sersic profiles. It is used for galaxy morphology analysis and photometry.

tools.name: pMAT
tools.one_line_profile: Fiber Photometry Modular Analysis Tool Suite for neuroscience data
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based analysis suite designed for fiber photometry data. It provides modules for data preprocessing, signal normalization, and event-related analysis, facilitating the interpretation of calcium imaging signals in neuroscience research.

tools.name: PythonPhot
tools.one_line_profile: DAOPHOT-type photometry algorithms implemented in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python translation of the IDL AstroLib photometry algorithms, providing functionality for aperture photometry and other DAOPHOT-style stellar measurements. It serves as a lightweight library for astronomical source characterization.

tools.name: unagi
tools.one_line_profile: Data retrieval tool for Hyper Suprime-Cam (HSC) Subaru Strategic Survey
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool designed to search and download astronomical data from the Hyper Suprime-Cam (HSC) Subaru Strategic Survey (SSP). It simplifies the process of querying the archive and retrieving FITS images and catalogs for analysis.

tools.name: libkd
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient Kd-tree library for FITS-based astronomical data indexing
tools.detailed_description: A C library (with Python bindings) for building and querying k-dimensional trees (kd-trees), specifically optimized for astronomical datasets and FITS file I/O. It is a core component of the Astrometry.net engine used for fast spatial indexing.

tools.name: The Tractor
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic inference framework for measuring astronomical sources
tools.detailed_description: A modeling framework for astronomical images that applies probabilistic inference to measure source properties. It allows for forward modeling of pixel data to extract precise photometry and astrometry, handling complex source blending.

tools.name: CaImAn
tools.one_line_profile: Computational toolbox for large scale Calcium Imaging Analysis
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive software pipeline for the analysis of large-scale calcium imaging data. It includes algorithms for motion correction, source extraction (CNMF), spike deconvolution, and component registration, widely used in neuroscience.

tools.name: trippy
tools.one_line_profile: Photometry tool for trailed astronomical sources
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool designed for performing photometry on trailed sources (e.g., fast-moving asteroids) in astronomical images. It addresses the challenge of measuring flux from non-point sources caused by object motion during exposure.

tools.name: MuSCADeT
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-band source deblending algorithm for astronomical images
tools.detailed_description: A method for blind source separation in astronomical images, specifically designed for deblending sources in multi-band data.

tools.name: drug_id_mapping
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for cross-matching drug identifiers across multiple chemical databases
tools.detailed_description: A utility to map and cross-reference drug identifiers from various databases like Drugbank, STITCH, ChEMBL, PubChem, and others into a structured format.

tools.name: astrometry-osx
tools.one_line_profile: Astrometry.net solver packaged for macOS
tools.detailed_description: A distribution of the Astrometry.net plate-solving engine specifically packaged for macOS, enabling astrometric calibration of images.

tools.name: novas
tools.one_line_profile: Naval Observatory Vector Astrometry Software (NOVAS) C implementation
tools.detailed_description: C implementation of the Naval Observatory Vector Astrometry Software (NOVAS), providing precise astrometric calculations.

tools.name: astro-fortran
tools.one_line_profile: Modern Fortran library for fundamental astronomy models
tools.detailed_description: A collection of modern Fortran implementations of standard models and algorithms used in fundamental astronomy and astrodynamics.

tools.name: EXOFASTv2
tools.one_line_profile: Exoplanet fitting software for transits, RV, and astrometry
tools.detailed_description: A software package in IDL for fitting exoplanet transits, radial velocities, astrometry, and stellar parameters.

tools.name: hugs
tools.one_line_profile: Low-surface-brightness galaxy detection pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed for the detection and analysis of low-surface-brightness galaxies in astronomical imaging data.

tools.name: FATS-2.0
tools.one_line_profile: Feature Analysis for Time Series (FATS) library
tools.detailed_description: A library for extracting features from astronomical light curves to characterize variability for classification and analysis.

tools.name: brutus
tools.one_line_profile: Brute-force modeling of stellar photometry
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for modeling stellar photometry using brute-force methods to estimate stellar properties.

tools.name: FourierImageTransformer
tools.one_line_profile: Fourier space image analysis tool for bioimaging
tools.detailed_description: A tool for solving image analysis tasks in Fourier space, developed by the Jug Lab (bioimage analysis).

tools.name: astropop
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomical Polarimetry and Photometry pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for reducing and analyzing astronomical polarimetry and photometry data.

tools.name: speculator
tools.one_line_profile: Emulator for Stellar Population Synthesis models
tools.detailed_description: A neural network-based emulator for Stellar Population Synthesis (SPS) models to accelerate the generation of galaxy spectra and photometry.

tools.name: Flora
tools.one_line_profile: Browser-based PSF fitting tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for performing Point Spread Function (PSF) fitting on astronomical images directly in the web browser.

tools.name: ExoSOFT
tools.one_line_profile: Exoplanet Simple Orbit Fitting Toolbox
tools.detailed_description: A toolbox for solving orbital elements of companions using radial velocity and/or astrometry data.

tools.name: FPA
tools.one_line_profile: Fiber Photometry Analysis toolbox
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox for the analysis of fiber photometry data in neuroscience experiments.

tools.name: gaia_ship
tools.one_line_profile: Star Cluster Finder for Gaia Catalog
tools.detailed_description: A tool for finding star clusters in the Gaia catalog using Friend-of-Friend algorithms and isochrone fitting.

tools.name: lofti_gaia
tools.one_line_profile: Orbit fitting with Gaia astrometry
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for fitting orbits using Gaia astrometry data.

tools.name: jointcal
tools.one_line_profile: Simultaneous astrometry and photometry calibration tool for LSST
tools.detailed_description: A package for simultaneous astrometry and photometry calibration, developed for the Large Synoptic Survey Telescope (LSST). It minimizes errors across multiple exposures to produce consistent astrometric and photometric solutions.

tools.name: scarlet_lite
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight source deblending tool for LSST-like images
tools.detailed_description: A lite version of the scarlet deblending code, specifically tuned for processing LSST-like astronomical images. It separates overlapping sources (deblending) to allow for accurate measurement of individual objects.

tools.name: catsHTM
tools.one_line_profile: Fast astronomical catalog access and cross-matching tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed for fast accessing and cross-matching of large astronomical catalogs using Hierarchical Triangular Mesh (HTM) indexing.

tools.name: abcd-pyhf
tools.one_line_profile: ABCD method implementation for background estimation using pyhf
tools.detailed_description: A pyhf-based implementation of the ABCD method for data-driven background estimation in high-energy physics analyses.

tools.name: Xmatch
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated astronomical catalog cross-matching tool
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance tool leveraging GPU acceleration to perform cross-matching of large astronomical catalogs.

tools.name: ADAM
tools.one_line_profile: Asteroid shape reconstruction from disk-resolved observations
tools.detailed_description: A software package for reconstructing the 3D shapes of asteroids based on disk-resolved observational data.

tools.name: SMO
tools.one_line_profile: Background distribution estimation for fluorescence microscopy
tools.detailed_description: A tool for robust and unbiased estimation of the background distribution in fluorescence microscopy images, aiding in quantitative image analysis.

tools.name: ssos
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for astrometry and photometry of Solar System Objects
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed to recover and measure astrometry and photometry of Solar System Objects (SSOs) in imaging surveys.

tools.name: sewpy
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for Source Extractor (SExtractor)
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper for the widely used Source Extractor software, facilitating source detection and photometry tasks within Python workflows.

tools.name: pyphot
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for computing synthetic photometry from spectra
tools.detailed_description: A Python suite to deal with passband photometry, specifically for computing synthetic photometry from spectra and handling passband definitions.

tools.name: PyASB
tools.one_line_profile: Absolute photometry and sky brightness analysis tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for performing absolute photometry and analyzing sky brightness using all-sky images.

tools.name: BlipFinder
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for searching dark compact objects via astrometric lensing
tools.detailed_description: An analysis pipeline capable of searching for dark compact objects in the Milky Way through astrometric lensing signatures in Gaia data.

tools.name: SextractorTools
tools.one_line_profile: Module for manipulating SExtractor source catalogs
tools.detailed_description: A Python module designed for reading, writing, and manipulating source catalogs generated by SExtractor.

tools.name: psfMC
tools.one_line_profile: MCMC surface brightness fitting for quasar host galaxies
tools.detailed_description: A tool for 2D surface brightness fitting of quasar host galaxies using Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) methods to separate point sources from extended emission.

tools.name: photometrypipeline (mommermi)
tools.one_line_profile: Automated photometry pipeline for small/medium observatories
tools.detailed_description: An automated pipeline for performing photometry on astronomical images, designed to serve the needs of small to medium-sized observatories.

tools.name: skymmich
tools.one_line_profile: Astrophotography management and plate-solving workflow
tools.detailed_description: A tool to sync astrophotography images from Immich, perform plate solving using Astrometry.net, and enrich the images with celestial metadata.

tools.name: ExoMiner
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning classifier for exoplanet validation
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning-based tool for automating the vetting and validation of planet candidates from photometry survey missions like Kepler and TESS.

tools.name: Astrometry
tools.one_line_profile: Library for converting star positions to WCS pixel-to-sky transformations
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that performs astrometric calibration by converting lists of star positions into World Coordinate System (WCS) transformations, enabling pixel-to-sky mapping for astronomical images.

tools.name: observerly/astrometry
tools.one_line_profile: Type-safe astrometry library for calculating celestial positions and events
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, zero-dependency TypeScript library for astrometry, capable of determining positions of solar system bodies, handling coordinate transformations, and calculating transit times.

tools.name: Open Foris Sepal
tools.one_line_profile: Cloud platform for geospatial data processing and earth observation
tools.detailed_description: A platform that facilitates the processing of geographical data in the cloud, enabling users to query and process satellite data for forest monitoring and land use analysis.

tools.name: SONIC
tools.one_line_profile: Object-oriented optical navigation toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolkit for optical navigation (OPNAV), providing tools for processing images and estimating spacecraft trajectories relative to celestial bodies.

tools.name: circRNA_finder
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for identifying circular RNAs from RNA-seq data
tools.detailed_description: A bioinformatics pipeline based on STAR aligner for detecting circular RNAs in RNA-seq data, as described in Westholm et al., Cell Reports (2014).

tools.name: ThePayne
tools.one_line_profile: Neural-Net compression and fitting of synthetic spectral grids
tools.detailed_description: A tool for interpolating and fitting stellar spectra using neural networks, allowing for rapid estimation of stellar labels from spectroscopic data.

tools.name: CMLM-ZhongJing
tools.one_line_profile: Large language model for Traditional Chinese Medicine
tools.detailed_description: A pre-trained large language model specifically designed for the domain of Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM), enabling knowledge retrieval and analysis in medical contexts.

tools.name: scarlet
tools.one_line_profile: Hyperspectral galaxy modeling and deblending tool
tools.detailed_description: A software package for source separation (deblending) in multi-band astronomical images, modeling galaxies and stars with non-parametric morphology and spectral energy distributions.

tools.name: FAMNet
tools.one_line_profile: Frequency-aware Matching Network for medical image segmentation
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a frequency-aware matching network for cross-domain few-shot medical image segmentation, designed to handle domain shifts in medical imaging data.

tools.name: astronoby
tools.one_line_profile: Ruby library for astronomical calculations and ephemerides
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Ruby library for calculating astronomical events, positions of celestial bodies, and handling time/coordinate conversions.

tools.name: everest
tools.one_line_profile: De-trending pipeline for K2 light curves
tools.detailed_description: EPIC Variability Extraction and Removal for Exoplanet Science Targets (EVEREST) is a pipeline for de-trending K2 mission light curves to remove instrumental noise and improve exoplanet detection sensitivity.

tools.name: THELI
tools.one_line_profile: Data processing pipeline for astronomical images
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for the reduction of astronomical images, capable of processing multi-chip cameras and performing astrometric and photometric calibration.

tools.name: crowdsource
tools.one_line_profile: Crowded field photometry pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A photometry pipeline specifically designed for crowded fields, optimizing source detection and flux measurement in high-density stellar regions.

tools.name: SEP
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for source extraction and photometry
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for Source Extraction and Photometry, derived from the C code base of the classic Source Extractor software.

tools.name: allphot
tools.one_line_profile: Automated wrapper for ALLFRAME/DAOPHOT photometry
tools.detailed_description: A shell-based automation tool for the DAOPHOT/ALLFRAME suite, facilitating PSF-fitting photometry on astronomical images.

tools.name: SFoF
tools.one_line_profile: Friends-of-friends galaxy cluster detection algorithm
tools.detailed_description: A galaxy cluster detection algorithm using the friends-of-friends method, operating in spectroscopic or photometric redshift space.

tools.name: Nemo
tools.one_line_profile: Millimeter-wave map filtering and galaxy cluster detection
tools.detailed_description: A package for filtering millimeter-wave maps and detecting galaxy clusters or sources via the Sunyaev-Zel'dovich effect.

tools.name: astrometry_geomap
tools.one_line_profile: FITS to Azimuth/Elevation mapping using Astrometry.net
tools.detailed_description: Tools to calibrate and plate scale images, converting FITS data to Azimuth/Elevation coordinates using Astrometry.net.

tools.name: pysiaf
tools.one_line_profile: Handling of Science Instrument Aperture Files for space telescopes
tools.detailed_description: A library for handling Science Instrument Aperture Files (SIAF), providing geometric transformations and aperture definitions for HST and JWST.

tools.name: pysynphot
tools.one_line_profile: Synthetic Photometry package (legacy)
tools.detailed_description: A package for synthetic photometry, allowing simulation of astronomical observations and instrument throughputs (predecessor to synphot).

tools.name: tweakwcs
tools.one_line_profile: Algorithms for matching catalogs and tweaking WCS
tools.detailed_description: A package for aligning astronomical images by matching source catalogs and updating World Coordinate System (WCS) information.

tools.name: zoomies
tools.one_line_profile: Kinematic stellar age prediction tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for predicting stellar ages based on kinematic data from Gaia astrometry and radial velocities.

tools.name: shell-detection
tools.one_line_profile: Galaxy shell detection algorithms
tools.detailed_description: Image processing algorithms designed to detect shell structures in galaxies (e.g., NGC 3923), developed with Gemini South Observatory.

tools.name: Photometry
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for astrometry and aperture photometry
tools.detailed_description: A collection of tools to improve image astrometry, retrieve photometric catalogs, and perform aperture photometry.

tools.name: TASOC Photometry
tools.one_line_profile: TESS Asteroseismic Science Operations Center Photometry Pipeline
tools.detailed_description: The photometry pipeline used by the TESS Asteroseismic Science Operations Center (TASOC) for processing TESS data.

tools.name: photparty
tools.one_line_profile: Automated square-aperture photometry tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool that automatically locates stars in FITS images and performs square-aperture photometry to produce magnitude data.

tools.name: HostPhot
tools.one_line_profile: Global and local photometry of galaxy hosts
tools.detailed_description: A tool for performing global and local photometry of galaxies that host supernovae or other transients.

tools.name: CADET
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning pipeline for detecting X-ray cavities in galaxy images
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning pipeline designed for the detection of X-ray cavities on Chandra images of early-type galaxies and galaxy clusters, facilitating automated analysis of astronomical X-ray data.

tools.name: pyse
tools.one_line_profile: Python Source Extractor for astronomical images
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of source extraction algorithms, designed to detect and measure sources in astronomical images, similar to the classic SExtractor tool.

tools.name: CCDLAB
tools.one_line_profile: FITS image interaction and processing environment
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive tool for FITS image interaction, world coordinate solving, point source extraction, and photometry, specifically supporting UVIT calibration data.

tools.name: speedyfit
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian SED fitting for single and binary stars
tools.detailed_description: A Python package to fit single and binary photometric Spectral Energy Distributions (SEDs) using Bayesian inference to derive atmospheric parameters, with automatic archive photometry retrieval.

tools.name: lemon
tools.one_line_profile: Differential photometry toolkit for astronomers
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to facilitate differential photometry on astronomical images, providing tools for lightcurve generation and analysis.

tools.name: backtracks
tools.one_line_profile: Relative astrometry fitting with background star motion
tools.detailed_description: A Python package to fit relative astrometry models accounting for background star motion tracks, useful for precise astrometric measurements.

tools.name: astrolib
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of astronomy utility routines
tools.detailed_description: A library of astronomical routines and utilities for data processing and analysis, providing common functions for astronomers.

tools.name: FoFCatalogMatching
tools.one_line_profile: Friends-of-friends sky catalog matching tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that implements a friends-of-friends (FoF) algorithm for matching sources across different astronomical sky catalogs.

tools.name: RESSPECT
tools.one_line_profile: Recommendation system for telescope resource allocation in supernova cosmology
tools.detailed_description: A recommendation system framework developed by COIN and LSST DESC to optimize telescope resource allocation for photometric supernova cosmology analysis. It aids in planning spectroscopic follow-up observations.

tools.name: lume-astra
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for the ASTRA space charge tracking algorithm
tools.detailed_description: A Python interface for ASTRA (A Space Charge Tracking Algorithm), enabling the configuration, execution, and analysis of particle accelerator simulations within the LUME framework.

tools.name: snmachine
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning pipeline for photometric supernova classification
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning library developed by LSST DESC for the classification of photometric supernova light curves. It provides tools for feature extraction and classification using various ML algorithms.

tools.name: astronomaly
tools.one_line_profile: General purpose anomaly detection framework for astronomical data
tools.detailed_description: A flexible framework designed for anomaly detection in astronomical datasets. It supports active learning and provides a visual interface to help astronomers identify and label interesting outliers in images or light curves.

tools.name: DeepCRE
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning framework for cis-regulatory element analysis in plants
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning tool for predicting gene expression levels based on cis-regulatory sequences (promoters and terminators) in model plants like Arabidopsis and Maize. It aids in deciphering the cis-regulatory code.

tools.name: ASTRA Toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance GPU-accelerated tomography toolbox for 2D and 3D image reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: The ASTRA Toolbox is a MATLAB and Python platform for high-performance GPU primitives for 2D and 3D tomography, widely used in physics, biomedical imaging, and materials science for image reconstruction.

tools.name: astroCV
tools.one_line_profile: Computer vision library specifically designed for astronomical image processing
tools.detailed_description: AstroCV is a computer vision library tailored for astronomy, providing tools for image processing, source detection, and analysis of astronomical datasets.

tools.name: Astro R-CNN
tools.one_line_profile: Instance segmentation and source detection in astronomical images using Mask R-CNN
tools.detailed_description: Astro R-CNN applies deep learning (Mask R-CNN) to perform instance segmentation and object detection on astronomical images, aiding in the identification of celestial sources.

tools.name: ClaRAN
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning classifier for radio galaxy morphologies
tools.detailed_description: ClaRAN (Classifying Radio sources Automatically with Neural networks) is a deep learning-based classifier designed to identify and classify the morphology of radio galaxies.

tools.name: morpheus.R
tools.one_line_profile: R interface for Morpheus matrix visualization and analysis
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides an interface to the Morpheus JavaScript library, enabling interactive heatmap visualization and matrix analysis within the R environment for bioinformatics.

tools.name: morpheus.js
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript library for interactive matrix visualization and analysis
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for versatile matrix visualization and analysis, commonly used in bioinformatics for exploring heatmaps and high-dimensional data.

tools.name: Morpheus
tools.one_line_profile: Proteomics database search algorithm for mass spectrometry
tools.detailed_description: Morpheus is a mass spectrometry-based proteomics database search algorithm designed for high-resolution/high-mass accuracy data, facilitating peptide and protein identification.

tools.name: Cosmic-CoNN
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning framework for cosmic ray detection in astronomical images
tools.detailed_description: Cosmic-CoNN is a deep learning framework and toolkit designed to detect and remove cosmic rays from astronomical images, improving data quality for subsequent analysis.

tools.name: DeepFocus
tools.one_line_profile: Few-shot microscope slide auto-focusing using CNN
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of a deep learning-based method for automated microscope slide focusing. It uses a sample-invariant CNN-based sharpness function to achieve fast and accurate auto-focusing in microscopy, which is critical for high-throughput biological imaging.

tools.name: Zoobot
tools.one_line_profile: Galaxy morphology classification using Bayesian CNNs
tools.detailed_description: A library for training and using Bayesian Convolutional Neural Networks to classify galaxy morphology. It is designed to work with Galaxy Zoo data and provides tools for predicting detailed morphological features of galaxies from images, supporting transfer learning for astronomical tasks.

tools.name: deepCR
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning based cosmic ray removal for astronomical images
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning tool designed to automatically detect and remove cosmic rays from astronomical images, serving as a robust alternative to traditional cleaning algorithms like LA Cosmic.

tools.name: MetaMorpheus
tools.one_line_profile: Proteomics search software with integrated calibration and PTM discovery
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive proteomics software environment that performs bottom-up, top-down, and label-free quantification analysis, featuring integrated mass calibration and post-translational modification discovery.

tools.name: ASTRA Simulator
tools.one_line_profile: High-altitude balloon flight path simulation tool
tools.detailed_description: A simulation tool for predicting the flight path and burst point of high-altitude balloons, used in atmospheric science and aerospace engineering.

tools.name: SuperNNova
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning framework for photometric classification of supernovae
tools.detailed_description: An open-source framework for photometric classification of supernovae using deep learning, supporting various neural network architectures for light curve analysis.

tools.name: CARTA
tools.one_line_profile: Cube Analysis and Rendering Tool for Astronomy
tools.detailed_description: CARTA is a next-generation image visualization and analysis tool designed for ALMA, VLA, and SKA pathfinders. It provides a client-server architecture for viewing large astronomical images and cubes efficiently.

tools.name: CARTA Backend
tools.one_line_profile: Backend server for the CARTA visualization tool
tools.detailed_description: The backend component of CARTA, responsible for handling data access, image processing, and streaming visualization data to the frontend.

tools.name: CARTA Frontend
tools.one_line_profile: Frontend interface for the CARTA visualization tool
tools.detailed_description: The web-based frontend component of CARTA, providing the user interface for interacting with astronomical images and cubes.

tools.name: voe
tools.one_line_profile: Virtual Observatory Events for Fast Radio Bursts
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for handling Virtual Observatory Events (VOEvents) specifically tailored for Fast Radio Burst (FRB) detection and alerts, developed by the CHIME/FRB collaboration.

tools.name: Firefly (IPAC)
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based UI library for astronomical data archive access and visualization
tools.detailed_description: Firefly is a web framework for building astronomical data access and visualization applications. It is used by IPAC for archives like IRSA and LSST.

tools.name: ASTAP
tools.one_line_profile: Astrometric Stacking Program and Plate Solver
tools.detailed_description: ASTAP is a free astrometric solver, stacking program, and FITS viewer. It is widely used for plate solving in astrophotography to determine the precise celestial coordinates of an image.

tools.name: toasty
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for creating WWT TOAST data tiles
tools.detailed_description: A Python library to generate TOAST (Tessellated Octahedral Adaptive Subdivision Transform) tiles from astronomical images for visualization in the WorldWide Telescope (WWT) ecosystem.

tools.name: HORAYZON
tools.one_line_profile: Terrain parameter and shadow map computation tool
tools.detailed_description: A package to efficiently compute terrain parameters (horizon, sky view factor, slope) and shadow maps from high-resolution digital elevation models (DEM), useful for meteorology and earth science.

tools.name: whampy
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis and visualization tool for WHAM Sky Survey
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to interact with, visualize, and analyze data from the Wisconsin H-Alpha Mapper (WHAM) Sky Survey.

tools.name: stac-finder
tools.one_line_profile: API for browsing SpatioTemporal Asset Catalogs (STAC)
tools.detailed_description: A STAC-compliant API implementation for browsing and searching SpatioTemporal Asset Catalogs, facilitating the discovery of geospatial and earth observation data.

tools.name: fitsgeo
tools.one_line_profile: PHITS geometry development and visualization tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for developing and visualizing geometries for the PHITS (Particle and Heavy Ion Transport code System) Monte Carlo transport code.

tools.name: dustmaps3d
tools.one_line_profile: 3D dust map based on Gaia and LAMOST data
tools.detailed_description: A tool/library to access and visualize an all-sky 3D dust map derived from Gaia and LAMOST survey data, useful for studying interstellar medium extinction.

tools.name: swarmlib
tools.one_line_profile: Library implementing swarm optimization algorithms for scientific computing
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that implements and visualizes various swarm intelligence optimization algorithms (PSO, ACO, GWO, etc.), which are commonly used in scientific modeling and parameter estimation tasks.

tools.name: gw_sky
tools.one_line_profile: Gravitational wave sky map visualization tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python project designed for generating sky maps and animations specifically for gravitational wave astronomy, aiding in the visualization of source localization.

tools.name: gleamvo-client
tools.one_line_profile: Client API for GLEAM Virtual Observatory access
tools.detailed_description: A Python client library for accessing the GLEAM (GaLactic and Extragalactic All-sky MWA) Virtual Observatory, facilitating astronomical data retrieval and query.

tools.name: CartAGen (Java)
tools.one_line_profile: Cartographic generalisation plugin for GeOxygene
tools.detailed_description: A Java-based plugin for the GeOxygene platform dedicated to cartographic generalisation, a process in GIS and geography for deriving smaller scale maps from larger scale data.

tools.name: ImagePy
tools.one_line_profile: Extensible image processing framework for scientific imaging
tools.detailed_description: An open-source image processing framework written in Python, designed to be extensible like ImageJ. It integrates with Scipy, Scikit-image, and OpenCV to provide a platform for scientific image analysis.

tools.name: AstroImages.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomical image visualization library for Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library dedicated to the visualization of astronomical images, providing tools to handle and display FITS data and other astronomical formats within the Julia ecosystem.

tools.name: SAOImageDS9.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia interface to SAOImage DS9
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package that provides an interface to the SAOImage DS9 astronomical imaging and data visualization application via the XPA messaging system.

tools.name: FIt-SNE
tools.one_line_profile: Fast Fourier Transform-accelerated Interpolation-based t-SNE
tools.detailed_description: A highly optimized implementation of t-SNE using FFT acceleration, widely used in bioinformatics (e.g., single-cell RNA-seq) and data science for visualizing high-dimensional datasets.

tools.name: auto_stretch
tools.one_line_profile: Automated contrast stretching for FITS image visualization
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool developed by LCOGT to automatically determine optimal contrast stretch parameters for astronomical FITS images, facilitating quick visualization.

tools.name: skyproj
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomical sky mapping with Matplotlib and PROJ
tools.detailed_description: A Python library from LSST DESC for creating publication-quality sky maps using Matplotlib and PROJ, supporting various cartographic projections relevant to astronomy.

tools.name: X-LoVoCCS-Data
tools.one_line_profile: Data processing workflow for LoVoCCS X-ray survey
tools.detailed_description: A repository containing the code and pipelines used to create the multi-mission X-ray data archive for the Local Volume Complete Cluster Survey (LoVoCCS).

tools.name: cartagen (Python)
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for cartographic generalisation
tools.detailed_description: An open-source Python library for cartographic generalisation, providing algorithms to simplify map data while preserving essential topological and geographic characteristics.

tools.name: OpenSpace
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source astrovisualization software
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive open-source software platform for visualizing the entire known universe, portraying ongoing efforts to investigate the cosmos. It supports interactive data visualization for astronomy and space science.

tools.name: SAOImageDS9
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomical imaging and data visualization application
tools.detailed_description: SAOImage DS9 is a visualization application for astronomical imaging and data analysis. It supports FITS images and binary tables, multiple frame buffers, region manipulation, and arbitrary scale algorithms and colormaps.

tools.name: BAStag
tools.one_line_profile: Data processing for British Antarctic Survey archival tags
